Hi,

I'm using Heretrix, over Nutch, the documentation seems more robust and
I'm not interested in Nutch's tight integration with Lucene - I want to
do quite a lot or pre-processing with the crawl data before indexing it
in our own format. So Heretrix seems a good flexible fit in this regard.

I want to crawl about 200k unique domains, using DomainScope. I'd like
to distribute this over n machines, with each machine running say 100
threads - one thread per domain. 

I'd also like to be able to track & manage the progress of each domain
individually. 

I'd like to do all of this by assigning one job per domain and have a
central management process that tracks each heretrix instance, and
assigns new jobs as appropriate e.g. as a job on one machine completes,
create a new one for another domain - keeping the total number of
running jobs in each instance at say 200.

The docs generally talk of creating a single job with a seed list. Will
I run into any issues within heretrix with having a seedlist of size 1 -
and instead having multiple jobs e.g. up to 200?

I'm guessing this should all be fine, but just want to make sure there
are no hidden gotchas.

Thx,

Joel
